summary: This document is an email chain from 2021 forwarding a 2018 email exchange between Justin Houston, a Program Manager at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal, and an unnamed Communication Technician at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The emails discuss technical IP address and port submittals for equipment, likely related to the installation or programming of an AMS server at the federal detention facility.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.role: Program Manager FBOP Contracts at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal
persons.context: The sender and primary correspondent in the email chain, providing technical instructions for IP address submittals to a federal detention center.

events.title: Email exchange regarding IP submittals
events.description: Justin Houston clarifies to an MCC Communication Technician that only one IP address and one port is needed per device for the submitted equipment list.

events.title: Initial request for IP submittals
events.description: Justin Houston requests IP submittals be sent to computer services to proceed with programming an AMS server.

locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
SigNet Technologies, 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The email chain involves technical coordination between a contractor (SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal) and the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The subject is the submission of IP addresses and ports for equipment, necessary to program an AMS server.
The correspondence is forwarded in 2021 but originates from 2018, indicating a review or archival process.
The MCC-New York is a federal detention facility where Jeffrey Epstein was previously held.
